misuses.description: The KeyStore.getInstance() method is used with a user-provided type, which could be vulnerable to a broken crypto algorithm attack. It is recommended to use a hardcoded, trusted crypto algorithm instead of a user-provided one.
misuses.recommendation: Replace the user-provided type with a hardcoded, trusted crypto algorithm.

misuses.description: The String.valueOf() method is used to generate a predictable key, which could be vulnerable to a brute-force attack. It is recommended to use a secure random number generator to generate a cryptographically secure key.
misuses.recommendation: Replace the String.valueOf() method with a secure random number generator.

misuses.description: The SecureRandom() constructor is used with the default seed, which could be vulnerable to a weak randomness attack. It is recommended to use a strong random number generator to generate a cryptographically secure random seed.
misuses.recommendation: Replace the SecureRandom() constructor with a strong random number generator.

misuses.description: The URL constructor is used with an insecure URL, which could be vulnerable to a man-in-the-middle attack. It is recommended to use a secure URL instead.
misuses.recommendation: Replace the insecure URL with a secure URL.
